description: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board has released the final timetable for SSLC and PUC examinations in 2025. SSLC-1 exams are scheduled from March 18 to April 2, 2025, while PUC-1 exams will run from February 28 to March 17, 2025. SSLC-2 exams will take place in May 2025, and PUC-2 exams are set for April and May 2025.

description: The Temba Bavuma-led side will look to script history by securing South Africa’s first series win in India since Hansie Cronje’s team triumphed in the 1999-2000 season. The two-match series begins on November 14 in Kolkata.

His emphasis on social justice and humble origins resonates as politicians seek to connect with voters, highlighting a yearning for integrity in politics.

description: An Indian national and six family members were reportedly denied entry into Pakistan to join a Sikh pilgrimage for Guru Nanak Dev's birth anniversary. Pakistani officials allegedly cited their Hindu faith as the reason for refusal.  Seven other Indian nationals from Lucknow also faced similar rejection at the border, despite completing formalities.

description: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has issued a crucial advisory for candidates yet to complete their UGC-NET December 2025 registration. The deadline to fill the form, pay the fee, and download the confirmation page is November 7, 2025. Applicants must verify all details before payment, as no changes will be allowed post-submission.

description: Rishabh Pant returned to India's Test squad for the series against South Africa starting in Kolkata, replacing N Jagadeesan. Pant proved his fitness with a strong performance for India A against South Africa A in the warm-up fixture. Key players will join the Test squad after the Australia T20Is, while Kuldeep Yadav gets early preparation time in Bengaluru.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Rahul Gandhi actively participated in rallies.

description: Thirteen-year-old Ilamparthi, initially an uninvited guest at a chess camp, has now become India's 90th Grandmaster. Guided by GM Shyam Sundar Mohanraj, his journey, despite financial hardships and family challenges, is marked by exceptional talent and unwavering discipline. The young prodigy's dedication promises a bright future in the chess world.

description: Zohran Mamdani celebrated his historic New York City mayoral victory with a vibrant rally, quoting Jawaharlal Nehru and promising ambitious plans to tackle the cost-of-living crisis. His win marks him as the city's first Muslim mayor, first of South Asian heritage, and youngest in over a century, embodying a message of hope.

title: 'Acting superior': Indian man assaulted in Canada; video sparks outrage
description: A disturbing video from Toronto shows an alleged drunk man assaulting an Indian individual in a cafe, sparking outrage and renewed fears of xenophobia. This unprovoked attack, where the aggressor hurled insults, follows a recent fatal assault on an Indian-origin businessman in Edmonton. Both incidents highlight growing concerns over immigrant safety and racially motivated violence across Canada.

title: Platform friction: Amazon warns Perplexity over its Comet browser; asks to stop bots
description: Amazon has issued a cease-and-desist to Perplexity AI over its Comet browser agent making purchases. Amazon alleges fraud and terms violations, claiming Comet degrades the shopping experience and creates privacy risks. Perplexity counters, accusing Amazon of anti-competitive behavior and protecting its ad revenue, marking a significant clash over autonomous AI agents.

title: After $12.6 billion Amazon stake cut, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott makes one of her biggest donations
description: MacKenzie Scott has gifted Howard University a remarkable $80 million, one of its largest donations ever, bolstering diversity and equity initiatives. This substantial, unrestricted contribution will aid student aid, infrastructure, and operations, arriving at a crucial time for the institution. Scott's ongoing philanthropic spree includes significant gifts to other DEI causes and a reduction in her Amazon holdings.

title: William Nylander opens up on his frustration and Maple Leafs’ struggles
description: William Nylander expressed his frustration with being sidelined due to injury, admitting the waiting game is wearing him down. His absence has impacted the Maple Leafs' offense and overall rhythm. Despite playing limited games, Nylander remains a crucial scorer, and his premature return could jeopardize the team's playoff aspirations.

title: George Springer’s wife Charlise breaks silence after Blue Jays’ WS heartbreak
description: The Toronto Blue Jays' World Series dream ended in heartbreak, but George Springer's wife, Charlise, offered a message of gratitude and pride. Her words highlighted the team's resilience and the lasting memories created, reminding fans that baseball's true value lies in connection and shared moments, not just wins. The team vows to 'run it back' next season.

title: Gisele Bündchen says prioritizing Tom Brady for years took a deep personal toll
description: Supermodel Gisele Bündchen, in a candid interview, shared insights into her marriage with Tom Brady, describing their split as a 'death and rebirth.' She detailed her journey of shifting from supporting her partner's career to rediscovering her own dreams and defining personal success. Bündchen emphasizes her graciousness towards Brady, highlighting her focus on authenticity and fulfillment in her new chapter.
